intro: Saccolabium mombasense, commonly known as the Mombasa milkweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature in the genus Saccolabium. The plant typically grows in woodland and savanna habitats, often in areas with well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive corona. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties are not extensively studied.
